intro: Schizocaena gaudichaudii, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. Schizocaena gaudichaudii thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its foliage is broad and leathery, providing a striking contrast to its vibrant blooms.
